com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine

Class WE

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.WE

  • public class WE
extends java.lang.Object
    The Main class of the engine. To create a new engine use launch(java.lang.String, java.lang.String[]) The Wurfel Engine needs Java >= v1.8 and the API libGDX v1.5.6 (may work with older version).

      • addIcon

        public void addIcon(java.lang.String internalPath)

      • launch

        public static void launch(java.lang.String title,
                          java.lang.String[] args)
        Start the engine. You should have passed a main menu first.
        Until the engine is launched it can take a while. Code that can only be run after the engine has openend should be run in the screen class.
        Parameters:
        title - The title, which is displayed in the window.
        args - Wurfel Engine launch parameters. For a list look in the wiki.
        See Also:
        #setMainMenu(com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.Core.MainMenuInterface)

      • getLwjglApplicationConfiguration

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplicationConfiguration getLwjglApplicationConfiguration()
        returns the pointer to the LWJGL configuration of the game window.
        Returns:

      • initAndStartGame

        public static void initAndStartGame(Controller controller,
                                    GameView view,
                                    LoadingScreen customLoadingScreen)
        Initialize the main game with you custom controller and view. This call shows the loadingScreen and disposes the menu.
        Parameters:
        controller -
        view -
        customLoadingScreen -
        See Also:
        startGame()

      • switchSetupWithInit

        public static void switchSetupWithInit(Controller controller,
                                       GameView view)
        Use this if you want to use different controller and views. This reinitializes them.
        Parameters:
        controller - the new controller
        view - the new view

      • switchSetup

        public static void switchSetup(Controller controller,
                               GameView view)
        Use this if you want to continue to use already initialized controller and view.
        Parameters:
        controller - the new controller
        view - the new view

      • loadEditor

        public static void loadEditor(boolean reverseMap)
        Switch into the map editor
        Parameters:
        reverseMap - reverse to the map at the point where you exited the editor?

      • startGame

        public static void startGame()
        Starts the actual game using the custom gameplayScreen. This is called after the loading screen.

      • showMainMenu

        public static void showMainMenu()
        Starts the actual game using the gameplayScreen you initialized with initGame(Controller controller, GameView view). This is called after the loading screen.

      • getCredits

        public static final java.lang.String getCredits()
        Get the credits of the engine.
        Returns:
        a long string with breaks

      • getWorkingDirectory

        public static java.io.File getWorkingDirectory()
        Returns the save file folder, wich is different on every OS.
        Returns:
        a folder

      • setFullscreen

        public static void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        You can switch to fullscreen. It only works if the current window resolution is supported by your hardware.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen -

      • getAsset

        public static <T> T getAsset(java.lang.String filename)
        Get an asset from the asset manager
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        returns the asset

      • isFullscreen

        public static boolean isFullscreen()
        Check if the game is running in fullscreen.
        Returns:
        true when running in fullscreen, false if in window mode

      • getAssetManager

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager getAssetManager()

        Returns:
        the asset manager.

      • getConsole

        public static Console getConsole()
        Returns the Console. Use Console.add(java.lang.String)to add messages to the console.
